abstract: The Civil War roots of American gunboat diplomacy in East Asia.
snippet: The Civil War roots of American gunboat diplomacy in East Asia.

lead_paragraph: One can only begin to imagine Commander James F. Schenck's indignation. Being fired on once without any clear provocation was troubling enough. Being fired on three times while flying a white flag of neutrality - that was an affront to the Stars and Stripes. What had begun as an investigation into the whereabouts of a missing American merchant vessel and its crew, during the summer of 1861 in what is now central Vietnam, quickly devolved into a lesson in respect for Western maritime customs.
